thread.title: The Atlanta Falcons choked away a 98.9 percent chance of winning the Super Bowl | For The Win
thread.title_full: The Atlanta Falcons choked away a 98.9 percent chance of winning the Super Bowl | For The Win

author: Luke Kerr-Dineen
title: The Atlanta Falcons choked away a 98.9 percent chance of winning the Super Bowl | For The Win
text:
The Atlanta Falcons choked away a 98.9 percent chance of winning the Super Bowl The Atlanta Falcons choked away a 98.9 percent chance of winning the Super Bowl By Luke Kerr-Dineen February 5, 2017 10:40 pm Follow @LukeKerrDineen 532 shares Follow @LukeKerrDineen 
When fans look back on Super Bowl 51, they’ll remember it as one of the best Super Bowls ever. As one the biggest comebacks ever. And, without doubt, one of the most painful collapses in sports history. The Falcons were up 28-3 at one point — handing them an almost 99 percent chance of winning the game — yet somehow they handed it away. Falcons win probability after Patriots TD- 98.9% pic.twitter.com/l8RKJbFRAj 
— ESPN Stats & Info (@ESPNStatsInfo) February 6, 2017 
The projections may not have been perfect at the time (these things seldom are), but the overriding point is clear. This was Atlanta’s to lose, and it did. More NFL!
